ticket.title: Script.aculo.us helpers "drop_receiving_element" and "sortable_element" broken in Rails 2.1.0
ticket.original-body:
Script.aculo.us helpers "drop_receiving_element" and "sortable_element" calling against a nil object and returning a NoMethodError exception. I have tested this same code on Rails 1.2.6 and it works successfully. Example view code 1:
drag
<%= draggable_element :dragit %>
drop here.
<%= drop_receiving_element :dropHelperDIV, :hoverclass => 'hover' %> Error "NoMethodError": You have a nil object when you didn't expect it! You might have expected an instance of ActiveRecord::Base. The error occurred while evaluating nil.[] Application Trace: /Library/Ruby/Gems/1.8/gems/actionpack-2.1.0/lib/action_controller/ url_rewriter.rb:102:in `rewrite_url' ticket.original-body-html:
Script.aculo.us helpers "drop_receiving_element" and

"sortable_element" calling against a nil object and returning a

NoMethodError exception.

I have tested this same code on Rails 1.2.6 and it works successfully.

Example view code 1:

drag

<%= draggable_element :dragit %>

drop here.

<%= drop_receiving_element :dropHelperDIV, :hoverclass => 'hover' %>

Error "NoMethodError":

You have a nil object when you didn't expect it!

You might have expected an instance of ActiveRecord::Base.

The error occurred while evaluating nil.[]

version.title: Script.aculo.us helpers "drop_receiving_element" and "sortable_element" broken in Rails 2.1.0

version.body: This has been verified broken on two separate servers.
version.body-html: This has been verified broken on two separate servers.
version.title: Script.aculo.us helpers "drop_receiving_element" and "sortable_element" broken in Rails 2.1.0

version.body:
I have essentially the same problem. If I do the following in a view:
Drop Here
<%= drop_receiving_element_js :dropTest, :hoverclass => "hover" %> I get the "You have a nil object when you didn't expect it! You might have expected an instance of ActiveRecord::Base. The error occurred while evaluating nil.[]" error. I can create this error consistently using Rails 2.1.0, ruby 1.8.6 or 1.8.5, running on a win32 platform using mongrel.
version.body-html:
I have essentially the same problem. If I do the following in a view:

Drop Here

<%= drop_receiving_element_js :dropTest, :hoverclass => "hover" %>

I get the

"You have a nil object when you didn't expect it!

You might have expected an instance of ActiveRecord::Base.

The error occurred while evaluating nil.[]"

error. I can create this error consistently using Rails 2.1.0, ruby 1.8.6 or 1.8.5, running on a win32 platform using mongrel.
version.title: Script.aculo.us helpers "drop_receiving_element" and "sortable_element" broken in Rails 2.1.0

version.body:
Same problem using rails 2.1.0 with mongrel on OS X 10.5.4, Ruby 1.8.6 (2008-03-03 patchlevel 114)...
And also using rails 2.1.0 with mongrel on Gentoo with ruby 1.8.6 (2008-03-03 patchlevel 114).
